results.title: Jack the Ripper: the final solution
results.creator_credit: Gary Rhodes, Jeremiah Downing and R W B Productions
results.brief_description: Will one of the most mysterious crimes perpetrated by a notorious unknown serial killer ever be solved? Who was Jack the Ripper and why did the killings end with the fifth victim? All will be revealed in this documentary - or will it? Based on Stephen Knight’s book of the same title, Ray McGregor travelled to London, to Whitechapel, where the infamous murders took place and managed to obtain an interview with the author himself. Many theories exist about who Jack the Ripper was and why his victims were all women prostitutes. Stephen Knight in his book and in this interview attempts to dispel the myths and put forward factual evidence. It would appear that the five victims were all women in their 40’s, living in extremely harsh conditions and working as prostitutes. The victims were: Mary Anne Nichols murdered on 31 August 1888, Anne Chapman murdered on 8 September 1888, Elizabeth Stride and Catherine Eddowes murdered on 29/30 September 1888 and Marie Kelly murdered on 9 November 1888. Queen Victoria expressed deep concern to the Prime Minister at the time of the first murder and the Royal link is explored even further by Stephen Knight. Includes still photographs, drawings and newspaper articles of the time.

results.title: Jack the Ripper
results.creator_credit: David Wickes, Euston Films and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Aired approximately 100 years after Jack the Ripper terrified London by killing 5 women, this British production made for television states it has discovered the real identity of the Ripper through extensive research by the director - namely based on top secret files from the Home Office, and interviews with leading criminologist and Scotland Yard officials. Heading the investigation is recovering alcoholic Inspector Frank Abberline (Michael Caine in a Golden Globe award winning performance), ably assisted by Sergeant Godley (Lewis Collins), and with a psychological profile provided by Sir William Gull, an authority on madness, and one of the Queen’s advisors. Heading the list of suspects is American stage actor Richard Mansfield (Armand Assante), the forensic medical examiner Doctor Llewellyn (Michael Hughes), Mr Lees (Ken Bones) - the Queen’s psychic adviser, Sir William’s son-in-law, Doctor Acland (Richard Morant), and social agitator George Lusk (Michael Gothard). Beginning with the first murder of Mary Anne Nicholls in Whitechapel, Abberline breaks through the resistance of the powers that be to try and unmask the Ripper and administer justice. Cast also includes Ray McAnally and Jane Seymour.

results.title: Mathsphere 2
results.brief_description: Mathsphere aims to bring the real world into the classroom. By placing mathematics in a real context, for example, the examination of environmental issues, the objective is to see mathematics as a human activity. Each episode is in two parts with a corresponding mathematical process or activity. Exercises and data are provided in the accompanying booklet. Topics include manipulating data, percentages and ratios, spreadsheets, geometry, algebra, trigonometry, statistical methodologies and fractions. The programs are pitched so that they can be applied to different levels of study.

results.title: Jack Rabbit
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of hundred-year-old Herman Smith Johannsen—nicknamed Jack Rabbit by Indians—the man who introduced the sport of cross-country skiing to this country. In the film we see him at the Canadian Ski Marathon north of Montreal, where he is the honored guest, and on a return trip to his native Norway. From present to past, his life is retraced with pictures from sports newsreels, Norwegian archives, and his family album. Narrated by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: Jack Hodgin's island
results.creator_credit: Robert Duncan, Don Hopkins and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of Canada’s most exciting new literary talents, West Coast author Jack Hodgins talks about his world and his work. Using passages from his short stories and novels, the film enters the world of logging camps and saloons, of people and events on Vancouver Island. At times serious, sometimes hilarious, other times introspective, it is a reflection of a storyteller who writes about what goes on around him.

results.title: Maths alive (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Howard and Educationa Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Shows primary school children learning mathematics from their own discoveries. The teachers have planned the work after careful observations of the children using materials in their own environment. Experiments undertaken are part of a sequence and show progression, but the children are free to follow particular interests as they arise. Music by Jocelyn Crompton.

results.title: Mojo working: Jimi Hendrix 1942-1970
results.creator_credit: Alan Douglas, Christopher Mould, Mark Neale, Gravity, Initial (GB) and Screen Ventures
results.brief_description: Part of the television documentary series “The Making of modern music”. Features live performance footage of Jimi Hendrix and personal commentary by various musicians, writers and critics in the music industry including Keith Le Blanc, Jaz Coleman, P.P. Arnold, Afrika Bambaata, Melanie Williams, John “Rhino” Edwards (Status Quo) and others. Songs include Purple haze, Johnny B Goode, Red house, The Wind cries Mary, Voodoo Chile, Wild thing. “Mojo working” is made up edited excerpts from original films by D.A. Pennebaker, Peter Neal, Peter Pilafian, Jean Peller/John Seay.

results.title: Mathematics at your fingertips
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In today’s classrooms various new ways are being tried to put children more at ease with numbers. This film sows one of them - a system developed by a Belgian schoolmaster, Georges Cuisenaire, who made sets of coloured sticks carefully designed to help children grasp simple mathematical relationships. As his method is demonstrated in a Montreal classroom we see how children ‘get the feel’ of numbers right from the start and advance confidently from the concrete to the abstract mathematical concepts. With children of StGeorges School, Montreal.

results.title: Mohamed Ali's happy day feast
results.creator_credit: Nicky Tyndale-Biscoe, Catherine Dyson and Little universe
results.brief_description: This poignant short feature follows the story of a young Somali refugee couple who start a new life in Melbourne. It traces their initial ups and downs, and their ultimate triumph in establishing a successful cafe, reuniting their family and becoming an integral part of the local community. Nominated for a Best Documentary prize at the 1999 AFI awards.

results.title: Modulo: variations on a design
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, Francois Seguillon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Camera animation of designs for an automobile, shifting between the drawings and the prototype, and suggesting through camera movements something of the speed and vitality of the machine. What emerges is the portrait of a leashed thing, an object that seems to tremble with life like any greyhound. Through the camera and the non-instrumental music the film creates a feeling of exhilaration, of being inside this machine designed for speed. A film without words.
